page.title: 09THE TOWN HALL,CONGLETON
page.content: The Congleton Town Hall is a major feature of the town both as an Information centre and as a source of many local activities. It is now mainly used for social events and local organisations hire the main hall for various functions e.g. scout fairs and fashion shows. Twenty years ago markets were held in the Town Hall, a cattle market on Tuesdays and a food market on Saturdays.Courts were also held at the Town Hall and police cells were at the rear of the building. Borough council meetings are still held at the hall now. The Town Hall has had many improvements. It has been sand blasted and a new clock face and wooden doors fitted. However the original stone flag floors remain having been reset and levelled.
